contentrichtext.text: Three ships of the [[Royal Fleet Auxiliary]] have borne the name '''RFA ''Orangeleaf''''': * [[RFA Orangeleaf (1917)|RFA ''Orangeleaf'']] was a [[Leaf class tanker (1916)|Leaf-class]] [[tank ship|tanker]] launched in 1916 in RFA ''Bornol'', renamed RFA ''Orangeleaf'' in 1917 and sold in 1947. * [[RFA Orangeleaf (A80)|RFA ''Orangeleaf'']] was a [[Leaf class tanker|Leaf-class]] tanker launched in 1955 as ''Southern Satellite''. She was purchased by the RFA in 1959 and broken up in 1978. * [[RFA Orangeleaf (A110)|RFA ''Orangeleaf'']] is a Leaf-class tanker launched in 1975 as ''Hudson Progress'', and later renamed ''Balder London''. She was acquired in 1984 and is in active service as of 2009. {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Orangeleaf, Rfa}} [[Category:Royal Fleet Auxiliary ship names]]
